Note: Very pleasing Portuguese red made from 70% Castelao, 20% Alicante Bouschet, and 10% Touriga Nacional. Medium ruby in the glass. Aroma profile is a tad muted, but plum, strawberry, raspberry, dried herbs, and smoked meat are present. Firm structure, and good mouthfeel to this. Strawberry, currant, and a bit of mocha. All in all a solid offering from Laitewaites.
Wine: Lobo e Falc√£o Wolf & Falcon Tinto 2020

Note: WSJ advent. Dark ruby. Fat syrupy legs. Rich blackberry, blueberry, cherry on nose. As it sits, almost a toffee smell emerges. Silky and full in mouth. Balanced with jam and light acid in front and more of a mild dry finish. Getting dark fruit, baking spices, coffee, cocoa in finish. Very similar to some mid-level Napa cabs without as much oak presence. Very enjoyable. 3.9
Wine: Lobo e Falc√£o Wolf & Falcon Tinto 2020

Note: Impressive red from Portugal. Tastes of Dark fruits , blackberry plum , licorice & cherry. Very nice and smooth, sipped by the fire pit on a cool night here in Boca . From the Advent Christmas wine (single glass case) collection ordered from Laithwaites. So far I‚Äôve had 4 glasses from this case , all are rated 4 + . Far superior wines than the 1/2 bottle case from Costco that I bought last year . Had a few sips with my burger off the grill topped with onions and bacon. A solid 4 .

Much better than Day 5 advent and very much appreciated! The Wolf and the Falcon, but very much a Wolf in Sheep‚Äôs clothing.

Note:
Day 6 of advent calendar.
Despite the very high average rating on here, it didn't do it for me afraid. It's like that disappointing rendezvous with someone you spent months flirting with + teasing. The attractive facade of the label + great reviews left me feeling unfulfilled from the first sip.
It's smooth due to chocolate + oak notes but the dark fruit feels unbalanced. At times it's juicy blackberry + plum; others it's sharp with acidity of blackcurrant.
Wine equivalent of a rough, scally lad I'm afraid.

Note: I come from a very aggressive line of itinerants.  The family motto appears to be: 'Listen (insert C bomb)'.  Not great is it?  Not conducive to a cosy chat over a deep rouge by the fire. This approach unnerves people, puts them on the back foot, It demands attention.  This wine used those words on me.  From the first sip I was in awe of it. It's smoother than George Clooney walking out of a barbers after a ¬£60 shave before sliding down the street on otter fur slippers. Top Drawer. In essence: Gunga Galunga
Wine: Lobo e Falc√£o Wolf & Falcon Tinto 2020

Romaneira
one of largest Quintas in region, with a total of 412 hectares and more than 3 kilometers riverfront on Douro river.  Vines were planted in terraces on steep slopes of the property: with many valleys and headlands,

Romaneira contains several microclimates and several slopes facing south, southeast and southwest.  
The resulting diversity means that ‚ÄúSingle Quinta‚Äù wines from Romaneira are produced from grapes from a complex mixture of sites.

Deze CARM is een blend van 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinga Roriz en 30% Touriga Franca. De Nacional is een druif met veel karakter en wordt gezien als het Portugees antwoord op Cabernet Sauvignon. Lots of flavour and concentration here. And for the price this is a very good buy.

Een vrij soepele tegen het stevig aan schurende rode wijn. Deze wijn is al heerlijk aan het flirten met de lamschenkel in de oven. Ze laat flink haar pruimen, rozijnen en braampjes zien. Na het geflirt dartelt ze wat tussen de bloemen al genietend van de zoete dropjes in het veld. Uiteindelijk komt ze samen met de lamschenkel waarna de vlammen er vanaf springen met wat hazelnoten en tabakrook als resultaat. Yam yam yam.

Powerfull and complex Douro red blend. Nose shows lots of dark berries, plum sauce and dark cherry. Great elegant tannin but lots of red current acidity. Would love to revisit in 5 y. 18,5/20.

I think I served this too cool & too young. It needs hours in the Decanter or years in bottle to open up a bit more.

Oh the red fruits and tannins, the dry, almost leathery finish. 4.3 say, and there's no rush to drink it - check back in a decade or two for something really exceptional.

Always as good as the first time I tried...back in 2003. This 2008 is powerful, full of Douro's best aromas. Fantastic.
Fantastic Douro! Great vintage. Full bodied and smooth. Well balanced with hints of black currant and vanilla.
Ruby red colour. Oak very prominent. Juicy, rich on the palate. Smooth velvety finish with mild savoury characters.

Focus on The Douro: Ferreirinha tasting 7/7. T. Franca, T. Nacional, Tinta Roriz. 12m in 50% new French oak. Douro Superior.

M. purple. Pronounced aroma intensity. V. floral & ripe w. succulent blackberry, black cherry, vanilla/cinnamon oak, creamy damson, loganberry & black raspberry. Elegant, stylish, powerful & rich.

Dry. M+ fine tannins, m+ alc, m+ acid, m+ body. Rich & opulent w. blackberry pie, damson, black cherry & concentrated plum. Toasty oak spice, chocolate & a structural long finish. Lovely!

95 Parker Points here and this time I can understand the rating! Dark Bordeaux red colour. Wine from the Westernmost vineyard of Europe in Colares (regi√£o de Lisboa). Made of the rare Ramisco de Colares grapes in sandy soils and protected by reed palisades from the gusty and salty Atlantic winds! Bottled historically in 0.5 l bottles!

Ramisco is very rare Portuguese variety confined to the Colares region in the sand dunes west of Lisbon, where pre-phylloxera vines are still found. Non-grafted vines are deeply rooted in the clay layer between 2-4 meters deep. Delicate flavors of exotic wood with spicy notes, pine nuts, mushrooms and cedar resina. Atlantic salty notes with a iodine flavor and red fruit. Smooth and velvety earthy notes with soft but firm tannins and crispy and elegant acidity.

deep ruby red. Elegant and complex nose of casis de Dijon, plum jam, discrete chocolate and vanilla. In between focused fruit aromatics elegant burnt wood and a touch of sage emerge. There‚Äôs also a bit of burnt rubber. Palate is bold but not excessive. Tannins are Powerful, at the same time rounded and grainy, you can almost eat them. Fruit feels like infused into and over the tannins, powerful texture backed by the acids. Aftertaste is a bit alcoholic and peppery. Capable for further aging.

A little bit lush - super smooth cherry & lingonberries with some wonderful fruity mid-tones and and orchestra of red fruits coming through, the tannins working in the background and a lovely turns-twist at the finish. Yummy!

It‚Äôs very difficult to find in Portugal many Wineries where are planted international grapes varieties like Syrah but one of the regions when the terroir allows this is Bairrada... where the climate is quite similar. Nice Syrah, expressive and elegant

When in Rome, eh? I picked this because of the iconic Portuguese grape, low alcohol and, frankly, Dirk Niepoort.
Expecting fierce tannins, astringency, alarming acidity and tough as old boots mouthfeel, I found something so much more charming. Quite a light bodied wine with punnets of fresh red fruit and well integrated tannins. Some balsamic astringency but in a pleasant and complementary way.
Not something you‚Äôre going to taste every day so when the chance arises, grab it! Unique!

Excellent example of Baga from the great Nierpoort who dominates Douro and has bought this Quinta in the Bairrada. Great attack, great acidity, complex, long close to a GC Burgundy. Worth the try

Bagaboom! Bairrada used to be Portugal‚Äôs underdog terroir, now it‚Äôs on everyone‚Äôs lips. The local Baga grape tastes like a fusion of Pinot Noir and Nebbiolo. Boom! 
Gripping nose of mushroom, clove, raspberry, violet, rose hip and truffle. Precise, refreshing palate of strawberry, black cherry, tar, tobacco leaf, anise, leather and white pepper slowly fading out as wood smoke. Elastic tannins, low alcohol. Understated power, this Baga draws attention with its elegant structure and deep minerality. Bagaboom!
Bought at Hedonism. Drank at One Aldwych Hotel. Excellent interesting wine. Good acid, not overly fruity. Leather. Cherry.
I had a coup de coeur for this red wine, super elegant bitterness coupled with profond cherry fruit taste.

Made from vines of Baga that are over 100 years old. Aged for 20 months in large vat. At only 11% ABV, this really smells like a Burgundy. Savory with notes of leather, sour cherry, stems, and earth. The nose gives way to plenty of old-world notes. Medium-bodied, this doesn't have the aggressive tannins that Baga can have. High acidity and a juicy finish. This is a wonderful effort for a tough vintage.

Ah, the Baga grape - such a fascinating, underrated, Nebbiolo-esque beauty. 

On the nose - wow, wow, wow. Musk, oud (yes!), old worn dark leather, tobacco leaf/cigar smoke, game, incense, dark wood smoke, sandalwood, rose hip, tar. 

On the palate, more oud, cedar, rhubarb, beetroot, raspberry, blackberry. 

Medium minus tannins, medium acidity, medium minus body. Just 11% ABV. 

2014 vintage tasted in 2021. Such a fun wine to drink. Paired with Parmigiano-Reggiano.

4.25 One of those wines that I'd happily drink every single day. Delicate and almost sexy!

Portugal tasting, with a couple of Niepoort wines now. Really nice funky earthy, floral, sweet red berry fruit nose. Quite Burgundian. On the palate pretty, refreshing, very elegant bright red berry fruit, with nice spicy herbal licorice notes. Good tannin structure, like quality nebbiolo this. Feels quite young. 4++++

Fantastic and easy-going. Slightly low alcohol content (12.5%) which makes it a great options for those days you want to take it easier.

Scent: Floral and perfumed. Hibiscus, honeysuckle, wild berries, bay leaf, white pepper, zucchini and blackberries. 

Looks: Dark red/purple.

Mouthfeel: Dry. RS is almost nothing. ABV is 11,5%. High acidity. Medium minus body. 

Grape variety: 100% Baga. Average age of the vines: 100 years!!! Hand harvested grapes. Fermentation in stainless steel tanks. Carbonic maceration which could explain the scent to some extent. Maturation in large neutral oak vats for 20 months. Bottled unfiltered. (3,2).

Delightful nose with strawberries, currants, flowers, earth and lovely spice. Light and elegant on the palate. Refreshing red berry fruit with a nice earthyness. Herbs and some licorice. Round mouthfeel. Balanced acidity. I see many has referred to this as burgundian. I totally agree. A surprisingly good wine.

On the nose floral notes, dark cherries, leather and smoke. On the palate this is a relatively dry wine, high on acidity and with a complex though refreshing taste of dark fruits, cherries, red currant and tobacco.  Lovely to a red bacalao.

Pale garnet. Soft tart cherry aroma. Mild dark berry taste with a clean middle and a warm fruity ending. Medium body. Acidity and tannins on the medium side. Well balanced. A fresh and easy drinking wine with a great taste. It was excellent.
A sanguine and elegant style, with crisp acidity behind the roasted cherry, plum tart and raspberry flavors, showing accents of iodine. The minerally finish has some peppery details.

This is a similar style to the Lagar de Baixo but I‚Äôd say more structure to it. Floral nose with hints of white pepper.  Cherry and lots of mineraity of the palate, finishing off with that pepper. 

This probably needs a bit more time than the Lagar de Baixo to reach its peak, but once again a spectacular wine.
